ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Survey - System standards and Performance
ygData.msgSnippet: Guess I should have read all my mail before claiming the worst system on the list.  BTW, I couldn t remember my sound card, but now that you ve posted it, yeah
ygData.messageBody:
Guess I should have read all my mail before claiming the worst system on the
list. BTW, I couldn't remember my sound card, but now that you've posted
it, yeah that's what I've got too. So tell me HOW are you getting 4
songs???!!

When you log on, about how many people are on your server? There's usually
1600ish on mine, and that number steadily rises till I go LD.

Heh, that reminds me, I've been going linkdead every night between 8:30 and
8:45 for about the last week or so. It's soooo bizarre! Last night I
announced this oddity to my group at 8:20. They laughed about it and told
me to stop being paranoid for the next 15 minutes. ;^)

Peace
Evulia, twink of twelve tunes, Tunare

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Bill Mann [mailto:dabard@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, July 26, 2000 8:08 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Survey - System standards and Performance
>
>
> > >Looks like I'm in the running for crappiest system on the list.
>
> heh! Try this on for size...
>
> Computer Specs for Bard Talespinner:
>
> CPU: 233 Mhz AMD
> RAM: 64 Megs
> Video Card (and RAM): Raven (Voodoo Banshee chipset) 12-16
> Megs (I forget
> exactly)
> Video Resolution: 800x600
> Sound Card: AWE 64
> HD speed (rpm): 7200 20gig drive
> 'Net speed: best connection w.56k modem... 24k Gotta love
> twisted wire ;p
> Geographic Location: Rural North La.
> Options enabled or disabled:
> Sky texturing: Single layer
> Particle Effects: Off
> Mip Mapping: Off
> Clip plane distance: All the way down in Kunark, 50% in old world
>
> How many songs can you twist? 3, 4 if I get reeeeeeeeeeeeally lucky
> Do you slow down when it rains? No, for some readon, I don't see the
> raindrops anymore *shrugs* go figure
> How about in Unrest or Kunark? Lag seems to increase for me
> during peak
> times, so my screen gets all jerky (yeah, yeah... I know... I
> need more RAM.
> That's what I get for buying EDO RAM three years ago when I
> built this thing
> ;p )
>
> -=B=-
> The Rathe
